intro: Lessingianthus rigescens, commonly known as the rigidlessianthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
